intro: Guettarda punctata, commonly known as the spotted guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
